Reviews.Title: A decent budget Android tablet
Reviews.Author: Nuknuk

} var node = cv_moFL9RNIZ1ZLBUpreplay.parentNode; var cv_moFL9RNIZ1ZLBUcurrentClick = node.onclick; node.onclick = function () { var head = document.getElementsByTagName("head"); if (head[0]) { var logTag = document.createElement('script'); logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_moFL9RNIZ1ZLBUcurrentClick) { return cv_moFL9RNIZ1ZLBUcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 3:41 MinsThe Simbans S73R is a very decent looking 7" screen budget Android tablet. The one I got has Android 4.2 installed. It is very light, mostly made with plastic. The screen is covered with a sheet of plastic to protect it during shipment. It already has some charge but you would want to plug it for a full charge the first time you use it. You can charge it either with the included AC adapter or with any existing USB charger you have in the house using a microUSB cable. Battery seems not bad at all and I do not really expect it to lasts as long as my iPad's battery.What you get:Tablet, AC charger adapter (100-240V world voltage with 5V, 2,000 mAh output), microUSB, short USB extension and a short manualI put in an 8 gig TF card (otherwise known microUSB card) to expand the memory. This will be very useful to put most of the pictures and videos. Not much of use for the apps as the apps will reside mostly in the internal memory. I think this is the biggest drawback as some apps can get really big and will put serious limitation to the number of apps you can install.The volume can be adjusted through a physical rocker switch on the side or with the touchscreen control. Screen brightness can be adjusted as bright, medium and low via the touchscreen.I am impressed how it performed with some of the games (maybe because I was expecting a lot?). Angry Birds Go which is crashing on my son's first gen mini iPad plays OK. It only stalled on the training sequence but played fine on the actual race. Temple Run2, Frozen, also played fine. I am more used to IOS navigation so there was some learning curve, but after using it for a few hours, I feel it was not that difficult at all. One thing I really miss is a physical home button. The tablet represents it with the house-shaped icon at the bottom middle screen. The touchscreen is responsive except when it gets hampered by the internet. I like the looks and how the clock, timer and stopwatch works. I have not seen any compass if it has one.Kindle app synched into my account right away and I was able to open the books with almost identical interface.Finally I tinkered with Skype. It works. My daughter was having a blast video calling to her brother and cousins. You can switch the camera back and front like Facetime. Again, the main difference is the cameras which is inferior to what we are used to.I didn't like that the 3.5mm audio jack located on top which makes the cord hangs in front of the screen when watching.What it can do:- Watching YouTube works great- Works even with recently released games like Angry Birds Go and Temple Run 2.- You need more light but you can call via video SkypeLimitation:- Cannot place a lot of apps as they reside mainly in the internal memory rather than the external memory.- According to the description, it can play Netflix. I downloaded it alright and navigates smoothly through the menus, but only audio and captions show up. No video. I tried downloading an apk to fix it but it won't install. Amazon Instant Video doesn't work likewise.- Capturing pictures and videos through the cameras are low res, muddy and distorted. Low light performance is much worse.- Resolution: 800*480 pixels- Screen brightness doesn't do much. It is only bright, medium and low. Still, you don't see much difference at all.Cons:- It behaves erratically at times, some of the apps would work alright and then stops working after a few days and requires to be downloaded and installed again.

Reviews.Title: love this tablet
Reviews.Author: Geraldine Gregory
Reviews.Content: my 6 year old granddaughter loves this so she can play games by herself it arrived in just a few days earlier than i expected to great deal.

Reviews.Title: Very nice tablet for the price
Reviews.Author: Frank Jetton
Reviews.Content: Tablet came with a screen protector.  Tablet is fast. The only problem so far is the wifi.  I have to have my phone hotspot within a foot for good wifi signal.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased
Reviews.Author: shawnj72
Reviews.Content: Very pleased.. Price and Quality will purchase another Will see how it holds up for the long term. A ok

Reviews.Title: not worth it
Reviews.Author: Jonni Onsurez
Reviews.Content: Netflix doesn't play video.  Already had to return the pink one I had purchased. I am not too sure if it is the brand or product.

Reviews.Title: Broken, Used POS posed as New, Unopened.
Reviews.Author: Brian Bradford
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item and received it promptly.That is when the problems started.The item I received was previously opened, and when I went to use it, had been previously used and configured.  It was missing the charger, but for some weird reason had two micro-usb dongles inside.When I went to attempt to charge the device with a micro-usb cable i had lying around (used for my smartphone for syncing), I discovered that the micro-usb jack was MISSING!  As in it wasn't even there!  Like it was a mocked-up display model.Meanwhile, before I discovered the missing port, I had called up Amazon to process a return and exchange.  Let's hope that the exchange works like its supposed to.* Update 4/30/2013The second, exchange item was also already opened.  The difference is this time all of the accessories were delivered with.The tablet has very very poor WiFi reception that intermittently resets.  The tablet was returned due to this issue.
